intro: Cleistopholis klaineana, commonly known as the African candlewood, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its unique, candle-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a leathery texture. The flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are borne in dense, cylindrical clusters.
